albums.name: Blackpink
albums.summary: On August 8, 2016, BLACKPINK made their debut album Square One, which contained the songs Boombayah and Whistle. The single reached number one on the Billboard World Digital Songs chart, making BLACKPINK the fastest act to ever do so, and only the third Korean artists to reach the accolade. PSY and Big Bang were the other two Korean artists to hit number one.

albums.name: Blackpink
albums.summary: Shortly following their debut in August 2016, BLACKPINK released Square Two on November 1, 2016. This included the songs Playing with Fire and Stay, as well as an acoustic version of Whistle. Much like with their debut, Playing with Fire also hit number one on the Billboard World Digital Songs chart.

albums.name: Blackpink
albums.summary: The group titled their debut Japanese album after their own name BLACKPINK with Japanese versions of Boombayah, Whistle, Playin With Fire, and Stay.
tracklist: 5. As If It's Your Last(japanese Version)

albums.name: Blackpink
albums.summary: On June 15 2018, BLACKPINK delivered their first EP, called Square Up, which featured several incredible songs. This included the now insanely popular Ddu-Du Ddu-Du, which was released as the lead single. Ddu-Du Ddu-Du is also the highest-charting Hot 100 hit ever by an all-female K-pop group, having opened at number 55.

albums.name: Blackpink
albums.summary: Kill This Love album was released on April 5, 2019. With Kill This Love, BLACKPINKâ€™s company revealed that the group would be releasing a more intense lead single than previously before. Their efforts paid off because the album became the first a Korean girl group to surpass 500 million streams on Spotify. The single was also no.1 in 35 countries on iTunes.

albums.name: Blackpink
albums.summary: The Album was released on October 2, 2020. This album includes a few songs that Blackpink coloaborated with other musicians such as Selena Gomez as well as Cardi B.
